path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Ceres Token Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf.pdf

findings.title: Missing zero address validation
findings.description: The input of address beneficiary should be checked for address(0), otherwise tokens minted to the zero address may be burnt forever.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.description: Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested with thoroughly.

findings.title: State variables that could be declared immutable
findings.description: The above constant state variable should be declared immutable to save gas.

findings.title: Public function that could be declared external
findings.description: The following public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.

findings.title: Reentrancy Vulnerability
findings.description: Relying on other contracts might cause reentrancy vulnerability.
